PredicateCore.js

  1. /* eslint no-unused-vars: "off" */
  3. /**
  4.  * PredicateCore
  5.  * @module core
  6.  * @namespace core
  7.  * @since 1.0.0
  8.  * @note rules are 100% tested from PredicateCore.test.js
  9.  */
  11. const merge = require('ramda/src/merge');
  12. const find = require('ramda/src/find');
  13. const curry = require('ramda/src/curry');
  14. const pipe = require('ramda/src/pipe');
  15. const filter = require('ramda/src/filter');
  16. const map = require('ramda/src/map');
  17. const takeLast = require('ramda/src/takeLast');
  18. const insert = require('ramda/src/insert');
  20. const option = require('option');
  22. const { EventEmitter } = require('events');
  24. function head(list) {
  25.   return option.fromNullable(list[0]).value();
  26. }
  28. module.exports = function({ dataclasses, invariants, errors, rules, UITypes }) {
  29.   const { CompoundPredicate, ComparisonPredicate, Predicate } = dataclasses;
  30.   /**
  31.    * Get a type by its type_id
  32.    * @param  {array} types types
  33.    * @param  {string} type_id   type id name
  34.    * @return {?dataclasses.Type}  a Type
  35.    * @private
  36.    * @since 1.0.0
  37.    */
  38.   const _getTypeById = (types, type_id) =>
  39.     option.fromNullable(find(type => type.type_id === type_id, types));
  41.   /**
  42.    * Get a target by its target_id
  43.    * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Target>} targets targets
  44.    * @param  {string} target_id target id name
  45.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Target, errors.Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget>}  resolved promise will yield a Target, rejected promise will yield `Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget` if target_id was not found in `targets`
  46.    * @private
  47.    * @since 1.0.0
  48.    */
  49.   const _getTargetById = (targets, target_id) =>
  50.     invariants.Target_idMustReferToADefinedTarget(
  51.       find(target => target.target_id === target_id, targets)
  52.     );
  54.   /**
  55.    * Get a logical type by its logicalType_id
  56.    * @param  {Array<dataclasses.LogicalType>} logicalTypes logicalTypes
  57.    * @param  {string} logicalType_id logicalType id name
  58.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.LogicalType, errors.LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType>} resolved promise will yield a LogicalType, rejected promise will yield `LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType` if logicalType was not found in `logicalTypes`.
  59.    * @private
  60.    * @since 1.0.0
  61.    */
  62.   const _getLogicalTypeById = (logicalTypes, logicalType_id) =>
  63.     invariants.LogicalType_idMustReferToADefinedLogicalType(
  64.       find(
  65.         logicalType => logicalType.logicalType_id === logicalType_id,
  66.         logicalTypes
  67.       )
  68.     );
  70.   /**
  71.    * Get an operator by its operator_id
  72.    * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Operator>} operators operators
  73.    * @param  {string[]} operator_id operator_id
  74.    * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Operator, errors.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator>} resolved promise will yield an Operator, rejected promise will yield `Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator` if operator was not found in `operators`.
  75.    * @private
  76.    * @since 1.0.0
  77.    */
  78.   const _getOperatorById = (operators, operator_id) =>
  79.     invariants.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator(
  80.       find(operator => operator.operator_id === operator_id, operators)
  81.     );
  83.   /**
  84.    * _getOperatorsByIds
  85.    * @param  {Object} operators operators
  86.    * @param  {string[]} operator_ids operator_ids
  87.    * @return {Array<dataclasses.operator>}
  88.    * @private
  89.    * @since 1.0.0
  90.    */
  91.   const _getOperatorsByIds = curry((operators, operator_ids) =>
  92.     pipe(filter(({ operator_id }) => operator_ids.includes(operator_id)))(
  93.       operators
  94.     )
  95.   );
  97.   const _set$operatorsToType = curry((columns, type) => {
  98.     type.$operators = _getOperatorsByIds(columns.operators, type.operator_ids);
  99.     return type;
  100.   });
  102.   const _set$typeToTarget = curry((columns, target) => {
  103.     const typeOption = _getTypeById(columns.types, target.type_id);
  104.     return invariants
  105.       .TargetMustReferToADefinedType(typeOption, target)
  106.       .then(type => {
  107.         target.$type = type;
  108.         return target;
  109.       });
  110.   });
  112.   /**
  113.    * Tap for Promise
  114.    * @param  {Function} f function to call
  115.    * @return {Function} function that accept a promise and will call `f`
  116.    * @private
  117.    */
  118.   const _tapPromise = f => {
  119.     return function(promise) {
  120.       return promise.then(result => {
  121.         f();
  122.         return result;
  123.       });
  124.     };
  125.   };
  127.   /**
  128.    * Run `fAfter()` (without any arguments) after `fBefore`, it will yield the promise yield from fBefore
  129.    * @param  {Function} fBefore fBefore
  130.    * @param  {Function} fAfter fAfter
  131.    * @return {Promise} promise from fBefore
  132.    * @private
  133.    */
  134.   const _afterPromise = (fBefore, fAfter) => pipe(fBefore, _tapPromise(fAfter));
  136.   // columns => Promise[columns]
  137.   const _initializeColumns = columns => {
  138.     // at first I used lenses, but the code was way harder to read so it's better that way :)
  140.     // wrap operators
  141.     columns.operators = map(dataclasses.Operator, columns.operators);
  143.     // wrap logicalTypes
  144.     columns.logicalTypes = map(dataclasses.LogicalType, columns.logicalTypes);
  146.     // wrap argumentTypes (allow argumentTypes to be undefined)
  147.     columns.argumentTypes = map(
  148.       dataclasses.ArgumentType,
  149.       columns.argumentTypes || []
  150.     );
  152.     // wrap types and set `$operators` attribute on each type
  153.     const wrapType = pipe(dataclasses.Type, _set$operatorsToType(columns));
  154.     columns.types = map(wrapType, columns.types);
  156.     // wrap targets and set `$type` attribut on each target
  157.     const wrapTarget = pipe(dataclasses.Target, _set$typeToTarget(columns));
  158.     return Promise.all(map(wrapTarget, columns.targets)).then(targets => {
  159.       columns.targets = targets;
  160.       return columns;
  161.     });
  162.   };
  164.   /**
  165.    * Create a new PredicateCore
  166.    * @param       {Object} args Predicate Core parameters
  167.    * @param       {?dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} [args.data=core.defaults.options.getDefaultData] data
  168.    * @param       {Object} [args.columns] columns definition
  169.    * @example <caption>Example of columns definition</caption>
  170.    * // don't forget to take a look at the Storybook https://ui-predicate.fgribreau.com/ui-predicate-vue/latest#/examples
  171.    * {
  172.    * // first define the operator list available along with what type of argument they need
  173.    * operators: [
  174.    *   {
  175.    *     operator_id: 'is',
  176.    *     label: 'is',
  177.    *     argumentType_id: 'smallString',
  178.    *   },
  179.    *   {
  180.    *     operator_id: 'contains',
  181.    *     label: 'Contains',
  182.    *     argumentType_id: 'smallString',
  183.    *   },
  184.    *   {
  185.    *     operator_id: 'isLowerThan',
  186.    *     label: '<',
  187.    *     argumentType_id: 'number',
  188.    *   },
  189.    *   {
  190.    *     operator_id: 'isEqualTo',
  191.    *     label: '=',
  192.    *     argumentType_id: 'number',
  193.    *   },
  194.    *   {
  195.    *     operator_id: 'isHigherThan',
  196.    *     label: '>',
  197.    *     argumentType_id: 'number',
  198.    *   },
  199.    *   {
  200.    *     operator_id: 'is_date',
  201.    *     label: 'is',
  202.    *     argumentType_id: 'datepicker',
  203.    *   },
  204.    *   {
  205.    *     operator_id: 'isBetween_date',
  206.    *     label: 'is between',
  207.    *     argumentType_id: 'daterangepicker',
  208.    *   },
  209.    * ],
  210.    * // then define the type, think of them as aggregate of operators so you can attach them to targets
  211.    * types: [
  212.    *   {
  213.    *     type_id: 'int',
  214.    *     operator_ids: ['isLowerThan', 'isEqualTo', 'isHigherThan'],
  215.    *   },
  216.    *   {
  217.    *     type_id: 'string',
  218.    *     operator_ids: ['is', 'contains'],
  219.    *   },
  220.    *   {
  221.    *     type_id: 'datetime',
  222.    *     operator_ids: ['is', 'isBetween'],
  223.    *   },
  224.    * ],
  225.    * // finally define targets, don't forget to specify their associated `type_id`
  226.    * targets: [
  227.    *   {
  228.    *     target_id: 'title',
  229.    *     label: 'Title',
  230.    *     type_id: 'string',
  231.    *   },
  232.    *   {
  233.    *     target_id: 'videoCount',
  234.    *     label: 'Video count',
  235.    *     type_id: 'int',
  236.    *   },
  237.    *   {
  238.    *     target_id: 'publishedAt',
  239.    *     label: 'Created at',
  240.    *     type_id: 'datetime',
  241.    *   },
  242.    * ],
  243.    * // define supported logical type
  244.    * logicalTypes: [
  245.    *   {
  246.    *     logicalType_id: 'any',
  247.    *     label: 'Any',
  248.    *   },
  249.    *   {
  250.    *     logicalType_id: 'all',
  251.    *     label: 'All',
  252.    *   },
  253.    *   {
  254.    *     logicalType_id: 'none',
  255.    *     label: 'None',
  256.    *   },
  257.    * ],
  258.    * // (optional) finally define how to display each argumentType_id
  259.    * argumentTypes: [
  260.    *   // here we don't define `component` because it depends on the UI Framework you are using (e.g. Vue, React, Angular, ...)
  261.    *   // since we are in ui-predicate-core here we don't know the UI Framework library that will be used
  262.    *   // read your UI Framework adapter (e.g. ui-predicate-vue) on how to set the component.
  263.    *   // if no argumentType is defined for argumentType_id, then UIPredicateCore will fallback on the default UI component (thanks to getDefaultArgumentComponent)
  264.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'datepicker', component: ? },
  265.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'daterangepicker', component: ? },
  266.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'smallString', component: ? },
  267.    *   // { argumentType_id: 'number', component: ? },
  268.    * ]}
  269.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.operators operators
  270.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.types types
  271.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.targets targets
  272.    * @param       {Object} args.columns.logicalTypes logicalTypes
  273.    * @param       {?Object} args.columns.argumentTypes argumentTypes
  274.    * @param       {Object} [args.ui] overriden core ui-predicate component (see UITypes and examples)
  275.    * @param       {Object} [args.options=core.defaults.options] options
  276.    * @return {Promise<core.PredicateCoreAPI, errors<*>>} resolved promise yield Predicate Core public API, rejected promise yield an error {@link errors}
  277.    * @memberof core
  278.    */
  279.   function PredicateCore(args) {
  280.     const { data, columns, ui, options } = args;
  282.     const _ui = ui || {};
  284.     return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
  285.       try {
  286.         dataclasses._requireProps(
  287.           columns,
  288.           'operators,logicalTypes,types,targets'
  289.         );
  290.       } catch (err) {
  291.         reject(err);
  292.         return;
  293.       }
  294.       resolve();
  295.     })
  296.       .then(() => _initializeColumns(columns))
  297.       .then(_columns => {
  298.         let _root;
  299.         let _api;
  300.         const _events = new EventEmitter();
  301.         const _options = merge(PredicateCore.defaults.options, options);
  303.         /**
  304.          * Loop through the predicate tree and update flags (e.g. $canBeRemoved)
  305.          * @return {undefined} nothing.
  306.          * @private
  307.          */
  308.         function _apply$flags() {
  309.           const canRemoveAnyPredicate = !rules.predicateToRemoveIsTheLastComparisonPredicate(
  310.             _root,
  311.             CompoundPredicate,
  312.             ComparisonPredicate
  313.           );
  315.           CompoundPredicate.forEach(_root, predicate => {
  316.             predicate.$canBeRemoved =
  317.               canRemoveAnyPredicate &&
  318.               !rules.predicateToRemoveIsRootPredicate(_root, predicate);
  319.           });
  320.         }
  322.         function _emitChangedEvent() {
  323.           _events.emit('changed', _api);
  324.         }
  326.         const _afterWrite = pipe(_apply$flags, _emitChangedEvent);
  328.         /**
  329.          * Set PredicateCore data
  330.          * @param {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} root CompoundPredicate
  331.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate>} resolved promise yield nothing, rejected promise yield RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate error
  332.          * @since 1.0.0
  333.          * @memberof core.api
  334.          */
  335.         function setData(root) {
  336.           return invariants
  337.             .RootPredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate(root, CompoundPredicate)
  338.             .then(() => {
  339.               _root = root;
  340.             });
  341.         }
  343.         /**
  344.          * @param {object} json user defined JSON
  345.          * @return {Promise<Predicate, errors<*>>} resolved promise yield the root CompoundPredicate, rejected promise yield an errors
  346.          */
  347.         function _fromJSON(json) {
  348.           return Predicate.fromJSON(json, {
  349.             getTargetById: target_id =>
  350.               _getTargetById(_columns.targets, target_id),
  351.             getLogicalTypeById: logicalType_id =>
  352.               _getLogicalTypeById(_columns.logicalTypes, logicalType_id),
  353.             getOperatorById: operator_id =>
  354.               _getOperatorById(_columns.operators, operator_id),
  355.           });
  356.         }
  358.         /**
  359.          * Add a ComparisonPredicate or CompoundPredicate
  360.          * @param  {Object} option option object
  361.          * @param  {string} options.type what type of Predicate to add
  362.          * @param  {string} [options.how=after] should we insert it before, after or instead of? (currently only after is supported)
  363.          * @param  {dataclasses.Predicate} options.where current element
  364.          * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Predicate>} inserted predicate
  365.          * @since 1.0.0
  366.          * @memberof core.api
  367.          */
  368.         function add({ where, how = 'after', type }) {
  369.           // currently only after is supported
  370.           return (
  371.             Promise.resolve()
  372.               .then(() => invariants.AddOnlySupportsAfter(how))
  373.               .then(() =>
  374.                 invariants.PredicateTypeMustBeValid(type, Predicate.Types)
  375.               )
  376.               // generate the Predicates
  377.               .then(() => _options[`getDefault${type}`](_columns, _options))
  378.               // then add it
  379.               .then(predicate => {
  380.                 const isComparisonPredicate = ComparisonPredicate.is(where);
  382.                 if (isComparisonPredicate || CompoundPredicate.is(where)) {
  383.                   if (isComparisonPredicate) {
  384.                     // it's a comparisonpredicate
  385.                     // first find predicates array that contains the element
  386.                     const path = _find(where);
  387.                     // we are starting from a ComparisonPredicate that always live inside a CompoundPredicate.predicates array
  388.                     const [compoundpredicate, [_, index]] = takeLast(2, path);
  389.                     compoundpredicate.predicates = insert(
  390.                       index + 1,
  391.                       predicate,
  392.                       compoundpredicate.predicates
  393.                     );
  394.                   } else {
  395.                     // it's a compoundpredicate
  396.                     // we want to add a CompoundPredicate after a compound predicate
  397.                     // so we need to add it as its first .predicates entry
  398.                     where.predicates.unshift(predicate);
  399.                   }
  401.                   return predicate;
  402.                 }
  404.                 return Promise.reject(
  405.                   new errors.CannotAddSomethingElseThanACompoundPredicateOrAComparisonPredicate()
  406.                 );
  407.               })
  408.           );
  409.         }
  411.         /**
  412.          * Remove a ComparisonPredicate or CompoundPredicate
  413.          * @param  {(dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate|dataclasses.CompoundPredicate)} predicate predicate
  414.          * @return {Promise<dataclasses.Predicate>} yield the removed predicate, will reject the promise if remove was called with the root CompoundPredicate or the last ComparisonPredicate of the root CompoundPredicate
  415.          * @since 1.0.0
  416.          * @memberof core.api
  417.          */
  418.         function remove(predicate) {
  419.           return Promise.resolve()
  420.             .then(() =>
  421.               invariants.RemovePredicateMustDifferFromRootPredicate(
  422.                 _root,
  423.                 predicate
  424.               )
  425.             )
  426.             .then(() =>
  427.               invariants.RemovePredicateCannotBeTheLastComparisonPredicate(
  428.                 _root,
  429.                 predicate,
  430.                 CompoundPredicate,
  431.                 ComparisonPredicate
  432.               )
  433.             )
  434.             .then(() => {
  435.               if (
  436.                 CompoundPredicate.is(predicate) ||
  437.                 ComparisonPredicate.is(predicate)
  438.               ) {
  439.                 const path = _find(predicate);
  440.                 // we are starting from a ComparisonPredicate that always live
  441.                 // inside a CompoundPredicate.predicates array
  442.                 const [parentCompoundpredicate, [_, index]] = takeLast(2, path);
  443.                 parentCompoundpredicate.predicates.splice(index, 1);
  445.                 if (parentCompoundpredicate.predicates.length === 0) {
  446.                   // if there are not any more predicates
  447.                   // inside the parentCompoundpredicate, we should also remove it
  448.                   return remove(parentCompoundpredicate);
  449.                 }
  451.                 return predicate;
  452.               }
  454.               return Promise.reject(
  455.                 new errors.CannotRemoveSomethingElseThanACompoundPredicateOrAComparisonPredicate()
  456.               );
  457.             });
  458.         }
  460.         /**
  461.          * Change a CompoundPredicate logical
  462.          * @param {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} predicate predicate
  463.          * @param {string} newLogicalType_id newLogicalType_id
  464.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate error
  465.          * @since 1.0.0
  466.          * @memberof core.api
  467.          */
  468.         function setPredicateLogicalType_id(predicate, newLogicalType_id) {
  469.           return invariants
  470.             .PredicateMustBeACompoundPredicate(predicate, CompoundPredicate)
  471.             .then(() => {
  472.               // first change the logical type
  473.               return _getLogicalTypeById(
  474.                 _columns.logicalTypes,
  475.                 newLogicalType_id
  476.               );
  477.             })
  478.             .then(logicalType => {
  479.               predicate.logic = logicalType;
  480.             });
  481.         }
  483.         /**
  484.          * Change a predicate's target
  485.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  486.          * @param {string} newTarget_id newTarget_id
  487.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate error
  488.          * @since 1.0.0
  489.          * @memberof core.api
  490.          */
  491.         function setPredicateTarget_id(predicate, newTarget_id) {
  492.           return (
  493.             invariants
  494.               .PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate(
  495.                 predicate,
  496.                 ComparisonPredicate
  497.               )
  498.               // first change the target
  499.               .then(() => _getTargetById(_columns.targets, newTarget_id))
  500.               .then(target => {
  501.                 predicate.target = target;
  503.                 // then change the operator to the first operator for this target
  504.                 return setPredicateOperator_id(
  505.                   predicate,
  506.                   head(predicate.target.$type.$operators).operator_id
  507.                 );
  508.               })
  509.           );
  510.         }
  512.         /**
  513.          * Change a predicate's operator
  514.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  515.          * @param {string} newOperator_id newOperator_id
  516.          * @return {Promise<undefined, errors.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator>} yield nothing if everything went right, otherwise yield a reject promise with the PredicateMustBeAComparisonPredicate error
  517.          * @since 1.0.0
  518.          * @memberof core.api
  519.          */
  520.         function setPredicateOperator_id(predicate, newOperator_id) {
  521.           return (
  522.             Promise.resolve()
  523.               // find operator
  524.               .then(() =>
  525.                 invariants.Operator_idMustReferToADefinedOperator(
  526.                   predicate.target.$type.$operators.find(
  527.                     operator => operator.operator_id === newOperator_id
  528.                   )
  529.                 )
  530.               )
  532.               // change the operator
  533.               .then(operator => {
  534.                 predicate.operator = operator;
  536.                 // then reset arguments
  537.                 predicate.argument = null;
  538.               })
  539.           );
  540.         }
  542.         /**
  543.          * Change a predicate's operator value
  544.          * @param {dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate} predicate predicate
  545.          * @param {*} newValue newValue
  546.          * @return {Promise<undefined>} yield nothing if everything went right, currently everything always go right ;)
  547.          * @since 1.0.0
  548.          * @memberof core.api
  549.          */
  550.         function setArgumentValue(predicate, newValue) {
  551.           return Promise.resolve().then(() => {
  552.             predicate.argument = newValue;
  553.           });
  554.         }
  556.         /**
  557.          * Get a UI Component (e.g. Vue Component) based on the argumentType_id
  558.          * @param {string} argumentType_id the argumentType id to find
  559.          * @return {*} it will either yield the argumentType id associated component or fallback on {@link core.defaults.getArgumentTypeComponentById} to yield the default component
  560.          * @since 1.0.0
  561.          * @memberof core.api
  562.          */
  563.         function getArgumentTypeComponentById(argumentType_id) {
  564.           return option
  565.             .fromNullable(
  566.               _columns.argumentTypes.find(
  567.                 argumentType => argumentType.argumentType_id === argumentType_id
  568.               )
  569.             )
  570.             .map(argumentType => argumentType.component)
  571.             .valueOrElse(() =>
  572.               _options.getDefaultArgumentComponent(_columns, _options, _ui)
  573.             );
  574.         }
  576.         /**
  577.          * Get default or overrided ui component
  578.          * @param {ui} name the UIType key to get the right component
  579.          * @return {any} component
  580.          * @since 1.0.0
  581.          * @memberof core.api
  582.          */
  583.         function getUIComponent(name) {
  584.           return ui[name];
  585.         }
  587.         /**
  588.          * Compute the JSON pointer path the element
  589.          * @param  {Object} element (http://jsonpatch.com/)
  590.          * @return {?Array} null if not found
  591.          * @readonly
  592.          * @since 1.0.0
  593.          */
  594.         function _find(element) {
  595.           return CompoundPredicate.reduce(
  596.             _root,
  597.             (acc, predicate, parents) => {
  598.               return element === predicate ? parents : acc;
  599.             },
  600.             null
  601.           );
  602.         }
  604.         /**
  605.          * Yield a serializable object without internal flags ($xxx properties)
  606.          * @example console.log(JSON.stringify(ctrl, null, 2)); // will call ctrl.toJSON() underneath
  607.          * @return {Object} a serializable object
  608.          * @since 1.0.0
  609.          * @memberof core.api
  610.          */
  611.         function toJSON() {
  612.           return Predicate.toJSON(_root);
  613.         }
  615.         /**
  616.          * Adds the `listener` function to the end of the listeners array for the event named `eventName`.
  617.          * No checks are made to see if the `listener` has already been added. Multiple calls passing the same combination of eventName and listener will result in the listener being added, and called, multiple times.
  618.          * @param  {string} eventName available event names are : (`changed`, api)
  619.          * @param  {function} listener listener
  620.          * @return {undefined}
  621.          * @since 1.0.0
  622.          * @memberof core.api
  623.          */
  624.         function on(eventName, listener) {
  625.           _events.on(eventName, listener);
  626.         }
  628.         /**
  629.          * Adds a *one-time* `listener` function for the event named `eventName`. The next time `eventName` is triggered, this `listener` is removed and then invoked.
  630.          * @param  {string} eventName see {@link core.api.on} for available event names
  631.          * @param  {function} listener listener
  632.          * @return {undefined}
  633.          * @see core.api.on
  634.          * @since 1.0.0
  635.          * @memberof core.api
  636.          */
  637.         function once(eventName, listener) {
  638.           _events.once(eventName, listener);
  639.         }
  641.         /**
  642.          * Remove listener(s)
  643.          * If off() will remove every listeners
  644.          * If off(eventName) will only remove listeners to this specific eventName
  645.          * If off(eventName, listener) will remove the `listener` to the `eventName`
  646.          * @param  {?string} eventName see {@link core.api.on} for available event names
  647.          * @param  {?function} listener listener
  648.          * @return {undefined}
  649.          * @since 1.0.0
  650.          * @memberof core.api
  651.          */
  652.         function off(eventName, listener) {
  653.           if (!eventName) {
  654.             // because removeAllListeners treat "undefined" as an event name :facepalm:
  655.             _events.removeAllListeners();
  656.           } else if (!listener) {
  657.             _events.removeAllListeners(eventName);
  658.           } else {
  659.             _events.removeListener(eventName, listener);
  660.           }
  661.         }
  663.         // get data for initialization
  664.         return (
  665.           (data ? _fromJSON(data) : _options.getDefaultData(_columns, _options))
  666.             // setup PredicateCore data
  667.             .then(_afterPromise(setData, _afterWrite))
  668.             // expose public API
  669.             .then(() => {
  670.               /**
  671.                * ui-predicate core public API
  672.                * @typedef {object} PredicateCoreAPI
  673.                * @namespace core.api
  674.                */
  675.               _api = {
  676.                 on,
  677.                 once,
  678.                 off,
  680.                 setData: _afterPromise(setData, _afterWrite),
  681.                 add: _afterPromise(add, _afterWrite),
  682.                 remove: _afterPromise(remove, _afterWrite),
  683.                 setPredicateTarget_id: _afterPromise(
  684.                   setPredicateTarget_id,
  685.                   _afterWrite
  686.                 ),
  687.                 setPredicateOperator_id: _afterPromise(
  688.                   setPredicateOperator_id,
  689.                   _afterWrite
  690.                 ),
  691.                 setPredicateLogicalType_id: _afterPromise(
  692.                   setPredicateLogicalType_id,
  693.                   _afterWrite
  694.                 ),
  695.                 setArgumentValue: _afterPromise(setArgumentValue, _afterWrite),
  697.                 getArgumentTypeComponentById,
  699.                 /**
  700.                  * Enumeration of overridable core ui-predicate component
  701.                  * @enum {String}
  702.                  */
  703.                 UITypes,
  705.                 /**
  706.                  * Get core UI component (e.g. target selector)
  707.                  * @param {core.ui} ui component name
  708.                  * @return {Object} component
  709.                  * @memberof core.api
  710.                  */
  711.                 getUIComponent,
  712.                 toJSON,
  714.                 /**
  715.                  * Get root CompoundPredicate
  716.                  * @return {dataclasses.CompoundPredicate} root CompoundPredicate
  717.                  * @memberof core.api
  718.                  */
  719.                 get root() {
  720.                   return _root;
  721.                 },
  723.                 // used for testing
  724.                 get columns() {
  725.                   return _columns;
  726.                 },
  728.                 // used for testing
  729.                 get options() {
  730.                   return _options;
  731.                 },
  732.               };
  734.               return _api;
  735.             })
  736.         );
  737.       });
  738.   }
  740.   /**
  741.    * Defaults configuration of PredicateCore
  742.    * @type {Object}
  743.    * @namespace core.defaults
  744.    */
  745.   PredicateCore.defaults = {
  746.     /**
  747.      * Defaults options of PredicateCore
  748.      * @type {Object}
  749.      * @namespace core.defaults.options
  750.      */
  751.     options: {
  752.       /**
  753.        * When data is not set at construction time PredicateCore default behavior will be to use the first target and its first operator with empty argument
  754.        * @param  {Object} columns every necessary data class
  755.        * @param  {Object} options PredicateCore available options
  756.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>}  root CompoundPredicate
  757.        * @since 1.0.0
  758.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  759.        */
  760.       getDefaultData(columns, options) {
  761.         return options
  762.           .getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options)
  763.           .then(comparisonPredicate => {
  764.             return options.getDefaultCompoundPredicate(columns, options, [
  765.               comparisonPredicate,
  766.             ]);
  767.           });
  768.       },
  770.       /**
  771.        * Default compount predicate to use
  772.        *
  773.        * This function is called whenever a new CompoundPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  774.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  775.        * @param  {Object} options PredicateCore available options
  776.        * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates array of predicates to include into the CompoundPredicate
  777.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.CompoundPredicate>} a CompoundPredicate
  778.        * @since 1.0.0
  779.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  780.        */
  781.       getDefaultCompoundPredicate(columns, options, predicates) {
  782.         return (!Array.isArray(predicates) || predicates.length === 0
  783.           ? options
  784.               .getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options)
  785.               .then(comparisonPredicate => [comparisonPredicate])
  786.           : Promise.resolve(predicates)
  787.         ).then(predicates =>
  788.           options
  789.             .getDefaultLogicalType(predicates, columns, options)
  790.             .then(logicalType => CompoundPredicate(logicalType, predicates))
  791.         );
  792.       },
  794.       /**
  795.        * Default comparison predicate to use
  796.        *
  797.        * This function is called whenever a new ComparisonPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  798.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  799.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  800.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.ComparisonPredicate>} a Comparison
  801.        * @since 1.0.0
  802.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  803.        */
  804.       getDefaultComparisonPredicate(columns, options) {
  805.         const firstTarget = head(columns.targets);
  806.         return ComparisonPredicate(
  807.           firstTarget,
  808.           head(firstTarget.$type.$operators)
  809.         );
  810.       },
  812.       /**
  813.        * Default logical type to use when a new comparison predicate is created
  814.        *
  815.        * This function is called whenever a new ComparisonPredicate is added to the UIPredicate
  816.        * @param  {Array<dataclasses.Predicate>} predicates specified columns
  817.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  818.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  819.        * @return {Promise<dataclasses.LogicalType>} a logical type
  820.        * @since 1.0.0
  821.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  822.        */
  823.       getDefaultLogicalType(predicates, columns, options) {
  824.         return Promise.resolve(head(columns.logicalTypes));
  825.       },
  827.       /**
  828.        * Get the default UI component for any argument. Also used if no registered UI component match `argumentType_id`
  829.        * @param  {Object} columns specified columns
  830.        * @param  {Object} [options=PredicateCore.defaults.options] PredicateCore available options
  831.        * @return {*} yield a UI Component (depending on the UI Framework used)
  832.        * @throws if the UI Framework adapter did not override this function. Each UI Framework adapter (e.g. ui-predicate-vue, ui-predicate-react, ...) must implement this and let user override it
  833.        * @memberof core.defaults.options
  834.        */
  835.       getDefaultArgumentComponent(columns, options) {
  836.         throw new errors.UIFrameworkMustImplementgetDefaultArgumentComponent(
  837.           'UIFrameworkMustImplementgetDefaultArgumentComponent'
  838.         );
  839.       },
  840.     },
  841.   };
  843.   return PredicateCore;
  844. };
Documentation generated by JSDoc 3.5.5 using the docdash theme.
